contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Senator |name=Dwight May Sabin |image name=DwightSabin.jpg |jr/sr and state=[[United States Senate|United States Senator]] <br> from [[Minnesota]] |party=[[United States Republican Party|Republican]] |term=March 4, 1883 – March 4, 1889 |preceded=[[William Windom]] |succeeded=[[William D. Washburn]] |birth_date={{birth date|1843|4|25}} |birth_place=[[Marseilles, Illinois|Marseilles]], [[Illinois]] |death_date={{death date and age|1902|12|22|1843|4|25}} |death_place=[[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago]], [[Illinois]] |spouse= |religion= |branch=[[Union Army]] |battles=[[American Civil War]] }} {{Infobox_Politician | name=Dwight M. Sabin | birth_date={{birth date|1843|4|25|mf=y}} | birth_place=[[Marseilles, Illinois|Marseillies]], [[Illinois]] | death_date={{death date and age|1902|12|22|1843|4|25|mf=y}} | death_place=[[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago]], [[Illinois]] | office = 9th Chair of the [[Republican National Committee]] | term_start = 1883 | term_end = 1884 | predecessor = [[Marshall Jewell]] | successor = [[Benjamin Franklin Jones (Pittsburgh industrialist)|B. F. Jones]] }} '''Dwight May Sabin''' (April 25, 1843{{spaced ndash}}December 22, 1902) was an [[United States|American]] [[politician]]. He lived in [[Stillwater, Minnesota]], where he had lumber and manufacturing interests. He served as a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] in the [[United States Senate]] from [[Minnesota]] from March 4, 1883, to March 4, 1889 in the [[48th United States Congress|48th]], [[49th United States Congress|49th]], and [[50th United States Congress|50th congresses]]. He was not renominated by his party. He served in both houses of the [[Minnesota State Legislature]].<ref>http://www.leg.state.mn.us/legdb/fulldetail.asp?ID=14621</ref> ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{CongBio|S000003}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-sen}} {{U.S. Senator box|state=Minnesota|class=2|before=[[William Windom]]|after=[[William D. Washburn]]|years=1883–1889|alongside=[[Samuel J. R. McMillan]], [[Cushman K. Davis]]|}} {{s-ppo}} {{succession box|title=Chairman of the [[Republican National Committee]]|before=[[Marshall Jewell]]|after=[[B. F. Jones]]|years=1883–1884}} {{s-end}} {{USSenMN}} {{RNCchairmen}} {{Authority control|VIAF=4489294}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sabin, Dwight May | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = April 25, 1843 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Marseilles, Illinois|Marseilles]], [[Illinois]] | DATE OF DEATH = December 22, 1902 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago]], [[Illinois]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sabin, Dwight May}} [[Category:1843 births]] [[Category:1902 deaths]] [[Category:People from Marseilles, Illinois]] [[Category:Minnesota Republicans]] [[Category:Republican National Committee chairmen]] [[Category:People from Stillwater, Minnesota]] [[Category:Members of the Minnesota House of Representatives]] [[Category:Minnesota State Senators]] [[Category:United States Senators from Minnesota]] [[Category:Republican Party United States Senators]] {{Minnesota-politician-stub}}
